intro: Campderia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican campderia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pods. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
